metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10068 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MSL interpreter in ImageMagick before 6.9.6-4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and application crash) via a crafted XML file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10068` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3').
